meanings.definition: To make something free of dirt or impurities.
meanings.sent1: She cleaned the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: I cleaned my room before my friends came over.
meanings.sent3: The cat cleaned its fur meticulously after playing in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The rain cleaned the streets of the city, washing away the dust.
meanings.sent5: He cleaned the windows until they sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To remove unwanted substances from something.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic cleaned the engine to improve its performance.
meanings.sent2: I cleaned the stain on my shirt with a stain remover.
meanings.sent3: She cleaned the spilled milk from the floor with a mop.
meanings.sent4: The janitor cleaned the graffiti off the walls of the school.
meanings.sent5: He cleaned the rust from the old bicycle, revealing its original color.

meanings.definition: To tidy up or organize a space.
meanings.sent1: I cleaned my desk to find my missing pen.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the living room before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: The child cleaned up his toys after playing.
meanings.sent4: The librarian cleaned the shelves to arrange the books properly.
meanings.sent5: He cleaned his workspace, putting everything in its place.
